Regions have in managing claims

* Create Users, Groups, and Regions using the

* Describe how Regions affect assignment of

Succeed Insurance has a very specific
organization structure that fits the way we
do business. | need to know how that
translates to the ClaimCenter organization.

Marcus
Business
Analyst

| Basic organizational structure

¢ Groups
* Organize the insurer’s employees
+ Users available to handle claims
* Can have users (people) as members
* Can have child groups
* Often mirror the insurer's organizational structure

+ For example, a main office has departments that contain
divisional offices that control local offices

« Users
+ People permitted to log into ClaimCenter
+ Involved in the claim settling process
+ May be assigned work
+ Belong to at least one group

* Experience Level

Users are characterized by:

| Groups Gi

Groups generally contain users that perform similar
tasks

Are hierarchical
Must have only one parent group

Support various ClaimCenter functions
+ Automatic assignment logic
+ Access

+ Supervisor and manager functions

Groups can be organized around particular lines
of business (auto, workers comp, property, and so on)

Groups can have regions (geographic areas)

| When and how does assignment occur?

Assignment occurs when:
+ An object (claim, exposure, and so on) is created
+ An object is reassigned

The owner can be:
+ Specified explicitly
* Chosen through assignment rules

Assignments are made to a Group and a User

During Claim creation
+ The claim is assigned
+ Any created activities are assigned
+ Any created exposures are assigned
